job_title: Assistant Director in Johnson City, TN
pros: The number of sick and annual leave days; tuition assistance; students are compassionate and kind
cons: Severely understaffed; good ole boys club mentality, so must be white and male to get ahead; women do not stay long unless they do not have children; POC do not stay long Bullies know they can get away with anything here. Eventually you will be bullied by someone and will need help disarming the bully, but HR will actively gaslight you.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Sneedville, TN
pros: Easy to get time off
cons: No room for pay increases

job_title: Director of Development in Johnson City, TN
pros: Great work/life balance, lots of PTO and holidays, solid pay and great benefits.
cons: Be prepared to spend a lot of time trying to un-see or un-hear all of the ethically terrible things you'll see and hear. People are treated poorly, there is a not-so-subtle undercurrent of racism, and in general, problems are swept under the rug. Senior staff at the VP level use intimidation and threats to keep problems from rising up to public level. Donors and boosters are sometimes problematic. Staff are treated poorly compared to faculty.

review_title: ETSU is a Friendly Place to Work
job_title: Assistant Professor in Johnson City, TN
pros: Smaller classes, flexibility for on campus and teaching hours, and a lot of budget transparency
cons: A lot of course preps for a professor, difficult to develop new classes, very little opportunities for research funding, or advancement beyond your department. Not a lot of diversity in faculty, some departments find it difficult to retain diverse faculty.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Johnson City, TN
pros: Great pay, amazing connections, hand on mentorship

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Johnson City, TN

review_title: I loved it, but that's probably largely due to the fact that they were paying for my education.
job_title: Front Desk Clerk in Johnson City, TN
pros: It was great because they paid for some of my education, and I got to help people. I learned so much about the underinsured / underpriviledged community how our healthcare system need an extreme overhaul. I learned so much about a different culture, and it didn't take long before I fell in love with the culture.
cons: There was always gossip and someone trying to underhandedly get someone fired because they don't see eye to eye on things. You better not mess around and joke with the wrong person who just might be having a bad day.

review_title: Acheivements come with hard work and time in, especially when everyone is broke.
job_title: Research Assistant II in Johnson City, TN
pros: Scientists collaborate often here and most machinery needed is available in a lab somewhere on campus.  Great benefits and high hopes by some professors.
cons: I could make much more money in industry or at a wealthier university.  Also, many professors with tenure have no ambition and no longer publish papers or apply for grants.  You must be selective about who you work for here or you will find yourself washing disposables because the lab can't afford to buy more.

review_title: The best place to work if you have a life outside your career.
job_title: Technician in Johnson City, TN
pros: Plenty of paid time off, flexible hours, training opportunities, fully funded education, health insurance and retirement options decent, yearly bonus for being vested, on-site food services, hour lunch breaks, no time clock, free use of workout facilities
cons: Pay is below average, Very few opportunities to move up, Not much structure, departments don't coordinate well, must pay for parking, change is very slow, new positions do not open very frequently

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Johnson City, TN
pros: Great place to work, great people to work with and for. Good hours and excellent benefits for the area. Great time off.
cons: Pay is very low for the amount of work. Pay raises do not occur annually and only occur when the state of Tennessee provides a raise to all. Amount of work, time of service, and other job responsibilities do not affect pay. There is also times when it is understaffed, and the hiring process is so lengthy that the times between hiring when a person resigns from their position leaves those left in a struggle.

job_title: Lecturer in Johnson City, TN
pros: I loved my years with ETSU. There are some phenomenal members of the faculty and staff.
cons: I developed an ulcer trying to improve the quality of the programs at ETSU. There are a large number of faculty and staff that do more harm than good to the university. Administration is bloated and overpaid, tenure is abused, and adjuncts are overused.

job_title: Associate Professor in Johnson City, TN
pros: Location; close to mountains! Overall low cost of living; decent schools in Johnson City. There is a big focus on health care here which is of benefit to the community.
cons: Pay, cronyism, "we've never done it like that before", lack of advancement opportunities. Schools outside of the immediate Johnson City area are in third-world condition. Housing prices are tremendously bifurcated with trailer parks or mansions with not much in-between.

review_title: Worried about the future of the university and the students' enrollment
job_title: Associate Professor in Johnson City, TN
pros: Less stressful. Good people to work with. Long summer and winter break
cons: Very underpaid. Tight budgets now.  Not many good collaboration opportunities.

job_title: Department Supervisor in Johnson City, TN
pros: Because ETSU is a state school, you receive state benefits. Most staff are kind and willing to help out other departments. Good place to start out in higher education or to finish out a career.
cons: The staff and professors are highly underpaid. This is evident by the burnout of majority of employees. There is also rumors of outsourcing, maintenance and facilitates, which has caused great displeasure.

review_title: Work with faculty and students in an office setting.
job_title: Executive Aide in Johnson City, TN
pros: Good benefits.  Feeling of unity campus-wide and support from the community.  Vibrant and active campus.  Plenty of activities for students to attend.
cons: Salary not great.  Compared with the salaries of other executive aides whose job descriptions are the equivalent or involve less responsibilities than those at ETSU, the pay leaves much to be desired.

review_title: Worried about the future direction of the university
job_title: Administrator in Johnson City, TN
pros: Located in a beautiful part of the country. The campus is prettier than many campuses. The easy-going culture lifestyle of the area makes life less stressful.
cons: Low pay compared to the same position at other universities. Very little chance for a raise. Lots of changes within the university provide a bleak atmosphere that is felt around the campus. Shrinking budgets in each department.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Johnson City, TN
pros: Johnson City is a nice place to live if you have little children.
cons: The schools uses adjuncts a lot and pays them very little. We are expected to deliver quality teaching, but we get next to nothing. Recently, the school announced a pay increase "across the board". Everybody got a raise except adjuncts.

review_title: Great benefits, horrible pay and atmosphere
job_title: Support Staff in Johnson City, TN
pros: The benefits ate fantastic! Great annual and sick time, a paid week off at Christmas, free tuition for employees, excellent health insurance.
cons: Pay is horribly below average. If you can't play politics you will not survive. Whatever you do, don't ever think the HR department will help you.

review_title: Working at ETSU is like being in high school. Your job is based on who you know, not what you know.

review_title: Working at ETSU has been rewarding.
